answers.answer: Hi there!Victoza usually causes loss of appetite. The increase in appetite is likely to be due to constant low blood sugar levels. It is important to understand that avoiding food is not the appropriate way to lose weight. Weight loss has to be achieved with a healthy balanced diet and adequate amount of physical activity. Cutting down on the diet is neither a healthy way to lose fat not recommended, especially in people with diabetes/ prediabetes.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: I was diagnosed with prediabetes a couple of years ago.  I started taking Victoza and quickly lost about 25 lbs.  I just wasn't hungry, and I got down to a healthy weight.  Over time, I've found that I'm hungrier, and now I've gained back nearly all the weight I'd lost.  Is there a way to reactivate Victoza's initial weight loss effect?Thanks.
title: Victoza/Regaining Weight
